qas.question: When did Protestantism begin to split?
What was one of the main causes of the split in Protestantism?
What Catholic belief did early Protestants not agree with?
What two substances are used in a Catholic Mass?
Whose body and blood is considered present in Holy Communion?

context: The Protestant movement began to diverge into several distinct branches in <a0_0>the mid-to-late 16th century<a0_0/>. One of the central points of divergence was <a1_0>controversy over the Eucharist<a1_0/>. Early Protestants rejected the Roman Catholic dogma of <a2_0>transubstantiation<a2_0/>, which teaches that the <a3_0>bread and wine<a3_0/> used in the sacrificial rite of the Mass lose their natural substance by being transformed into the body, blood, soul, and divinity of Christ. They disagreed with one another concerning the presence of <a4_0>Christ<a4_0/> and his body and blood in Holy Communion.
